label: Description
value: Simulates damask. Heavy foliate forms in bisymmetrical arrangement. Printed in red on darker red ground.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Drop repeating motif. A large symmetrical foliate and strapwork frame enclosed a symmetrical diapered medallion, the base of which is enfolded in large leaves. Trailing roses in the spaces around the frames. Printed on gray ground.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length purchased for the decoration of Schloss Weikersheim, Wurttemberg, Germany.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Symmetrical Rococo design of silver gilt arabesques and cartouches, combined with naturalistic flowers in polychrome silks, on ivory silk ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic yarns, parchment Technique: embroidered in satin and knotted stitches on plain weave over parchment shapes

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. Three-quarter length figure of a bearded man, turned toward the left. He is heavily draped, including a hood-like covering over his head. His left hand is raised to his head in gesture of deep thought. signed, lower right.

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. Bust-length portrait of a young woman, facing the spectator, her figure turned toward the right.

label: Description
value: Section of fine, loose plain weave printed with close-set diagonal repeat of small dark spray with two large white buds.  Central panel has this design enhanced with gold outlines, gold dots powdered in interstices.  Ground originally dark yellow-green, now dull brown.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed or painted on plain weave with dye, gold powder on wax or gum base

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 20.3 x 44.8 cm (8 in. x 17 5/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Section of very fine sheer tan plain weave with close-set horizontal zig-zags of tiny gold dots, giving continuous chevron effect.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: printed and painted on plain weave, gold powder on wax or gum base

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 38.4 x 11.4 cm (15 1/8 x 4 1/2 in.)

label: Description
value: Close-set diagonal repeat of small pointed leaf outlined in black and decorated with gold dot in lower part, above tiny stem; on dull yellow-green ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed or painted on plain weave with dye, gold powder on wax or gum base

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 25.7 x 12.4 cm (10 1/8 x 4 7/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Rectangle of very fine, loosely woven undyed plain weave cotton with small-scale all-over repeat of small pointed leaf, in green enamel with gold leaf, in close-set wavy trellis framework of silver leaf; gold dot at each intersection of the trellis.  Tiny impressed dots in gold accentuate design of each leaf.  Undecorated margin on left side (1 cm).

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed or painted on plain weave, metal powder and enamel on gum or wax base

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 18.7 x 14 cm (7 3/8 x 5 1/2 in.)

label: Description
value: Strip of very sheer, loosely woven undyed plain weave cotton with small-scale design of hatched stripe in gold leaf alternating with stripe with central black line with pairs of small leaves drawn in black and painted pale lavender springing on either side of gold dots close-set on the central line.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: painted on plain weave with dye, gold powder on gum or wax base

label: Description
value: Strip of very fine sheer undyed silk plain weave with small-scale all-over design of diamonds within diamonds in diamond trellis, all drawn in line of gold dots.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: printed or pounced on plain weave, gold powder on gum or wax base

label: Description
value: Strip of very fine, loosely woven terra-cotta cotton plain weave with minute close-set diagonal repeat of flower sprig with pair of leaves and gold dot filling blossom, drawn in black.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed and painted on plain weave, gold powder on gum or wax base

label: Description
value: Vertical-horizontal repeat of large squares broken by small geometric trellis framework and other broad bands of geometric patterning. Reversible "Summer and Winter" weave in dark blue and white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, cotton Technique: double cloth

label: Description
value: Vertical panel with medium-scale diagonal repeat giving allover effect of large symmetrical urns with addorsed birds on either side of vase, confronted birds on either side of fleur-de-lis rising from the top. Top and bottom border of several small geometric bands.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, wool Technique: plain weave with supplementary warp

label: Provenance
value: Natalie K. Blair; 1952: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of Natalie K. Blair

label: Description
value:
Old wrought steel oil lamp on tripod stand with ring foot
a) single wick Betty lamp with cut-out bird on nail hinged cover. Handle bent forward, its hole holding a modern 8-shaped chain link, hooked into hanging staple. b) Tripod stand on ring base, with pointed oval tray on top.

label: Credit line
value: GIft of the Estate of Natalie K. Blair

label: Description
value: Ebonized and gilded tôle square lantern. Small ball feet and circular stepped top with pierced pattern. At each upper corner, an upright gilded elm leaf. At top, a flat suspension ring. Square bottom inset with two candle holders painted red.

label: Provenance
value: Natalie K. Blair; 1952: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of Natalie K. Blair

label: Description
value: Long scarf of crimson silk twill brocaded in multicolored cotton with deep end borders of a horizontal row of large close-set "cones," stylized floral guards bands top and bottom) and smaller detached "cones" in close-set horizontal rows on body of scarf. Silk and cotton floral galloon applied up long sides, which have been cut.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, cotton Technique: twill weave

label: Description
value: Octagonal form of wood and metal wire; ogee arches springing from clustered columns on the eight corners; one side with hinged door. Ogee domed top with pierced imbrication and leafy finial. Bottom of sheet metal. Two perches and a swing in interior.

label: Physical description
value: Carved and joined mahogany, metal wire, sheet metal

label: Provenance
value: Alfred G. Burnham; 1952: acquired by the Museum

label: Description
value: Wallpaper panel hung on the walls of the drawing room (but later removed) in the Jumel Mansion, New York City. Doves with vases and morning glories at top and at bottom. Sidewall composed of drop repeating rows of stylized daisies and leaves in dark green.

label: Provenance
value: Hung on the walls of the drawing room in the Jumel Mansion, New York City.

label: Description
value: Printed cotton fragment. Blue dye on white ground showing equestrian hunters with hounds in landscape.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: roller printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: White silk floral damask embroidered with scattered animals, birds and insects in colored silks and metal threads. With an embroidered obelisk surmounted by a coronet with serpents on either side. Composed of four smaller pieces, stitched together.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk Technique: embroidered on damask weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 169 x 49 cm (5 ft. 6 9/16 in. x 19 5/16 in.)

value: Cotton printed with design of vertical stripes with alternating rows of flowering vines or scattered blooms.

value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by block on plain weave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1952: Richard Cranch Greenleaf collection; 1952: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Flat black silk taffeta sack or bag, with wide flat top, and drawstring. Type of bag which was used for tail of wig to keep wig off collar.

label: Description
value: Two panels of cotton, plain cloth, printed in red, copper plate. Chinoiserie design inspired by an opera by Gretry "panurge dans l'Isle des Lanternes," design horizontally arranged shows performers on a stage, processions, etc., personages in fantastic dress.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate

label: Description
value: Panel of linen printed in red showing a chinoiserie design inspired by the Opera Panurge dans l'Isle des Lanternes: comédie lirique en trois actes written by André Ernest Modeste Grétry (1741-1813) and first performed in 1785. The design shows processions of personages in fantastic dress and performers on a stage.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Description
value: Panel of cotton printed in red showing a design of women harvesting grapes; country folk dancing and courting; a  man in a swing with another on the ground holding a bottle.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1952: Richard Cranch Greenleaf collection; 1952: acquired by the Museum.
